intro: Utania stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf utania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Utania stenophylla typically grows in wet, swampy areas and is often found in marshy habitats. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a habitat for various small organisms.
